name: Queenstown
fun_fact: Fun fact: Queenstown is the birthplace of commercial bungy jumping! On November 12, 1988, New Zealander AJ Hackett and Henry van Asch opened the world's first commercial bungy operation at Kawarau Bridge (43m drop). The Nevis Bungy, at 134m, is now the Southern Hemisphere's highest with 8.5 seconds of freefall. Queenstown earned its nickname 'World Home of Adventure' by literally inventing the modern adventure tourism industry!

hero_dishes.name: Fergburger
hero_dishes.description: Legendary gourmet burgers with creative combinations and massive portions. The Ferg Deluxe features multiple patties, bacon, cheese, and special sauce in a fluffy artisan bun. Juicy, mouthwatering, Instagram-famous, and tastes as good as it looks.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Opened in 2001 in downtown Queenstown, Fergburger has become a New Zealand institution. Lines stretch down Shotover Street at all hours. It's not just tourist hype - locals genuinely love it and it's always trending on Instagram.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: 42 Shotover Street, Queenstown. Prepare for lines but they move fast. Also expanded to Fergbaker (kiwi classic pies) and ice cream parlor next door.

hero_dishes.name: Central Otago Pinot Noir with Local Lamb
hero_dishes.description: Grass-fed Te Mana lamb rump paired with world-renowned Central Otago Pinot Noir from the world's southernmost wine region. The lamb is tender, rich, and distinctly New Zealand.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Queenstown region has 100+ wineries within 40 minutes, particularly famous for Pinot Noir. New Zealand lamb is legendary for its quality due to grass-fed practices and pristine environment.

hero_dishes.name: Polynasian Cuisine at Blue Kanu
hero_dishes.description: Pacific Asian fusion specializing in seafood - combining Polynesian and Asian flavors. Fresh fish, tropical ingredients, and creative flavor combinations.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Reflects New Zealand's Pacific location and multicultural identity. Often considered Queenstown's best restaurant by locals.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Blue Kanu restaurant - firm favorite with locals and visitors alike

hero_dishes.name: Brunch at Yonder
hero_dishes.description: Voted top 10 brunch spot in all of New Zealand. Specializes in vegan and vegetarian dishes with the best coffee in Queenstown according to locals. Fresh, creative, Instagram-worthy.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Represents Queenstown's modern, health-conscious food scene alongside traditional hearty meals.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Yonder - serves brunch, dinner, and drinks with unpretentious service

signature_drinks.name: Central Otago Pinot Noir
signature_drinks.description: World-class Pinot Noir from the world's southernmost wine region. Elegant, complex, with dark fruit flavors and silky texture.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Visited at source - over 100 wineries within 40 minutes of Queenstown. Gibbston Valley Winery has New Zealand's largest wine cave with historic vineyards. Wine tourism is as important as adventure tourism here.

signature_drinks.name: Craft Beer at Local Breweries
signature_drinks.description: New Zealand craft beer scene is thriving - hoppy IPAs, crisp lagers, and creative seasonal brews.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: After adventure activities, locals unwind at craft breweries and bars. Beer culture is laid-back and social.

signature_drinks.name: Flat White
signature_drinks.description: New Zealand's coffee culture is world-class. Flat white (invented in NZ/Australia) is the local favorite - velvety microfoam with strong espresso.
